column1: Software Engineer;;30/12/2024;;36 uren per week;Den Haag;26/04/2024;Ministry of Justice and Security (JenV);"

column11: Experience: 10 years development experience in Java
column19: 'Subject: Application for the position of Software Engineer at Ministry of Justice and Security (JenV)\n\nFrom: John Doe on behalf of MareVisie B.v.
column22: \n\nI am writing to express my interest in the Software Engineer position at the Ministry of Justice and Security as advertised. With a robust background in technical computing and software engineering
column23: complemented by over a decade of hands-on experience in programming and development
column24: I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your team.\n\nI hold a Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering and have acquired certifications in Scrum Foundations and Scrum Master
column25: which have equipped me with the methodologies required to manage and lead projects efficiently. My professional journey spans over ten years in Java development and fifteen years in Python
column26: aligning with the technical requirements of the role. Additionally
column27: my six years of experience with Postgres
column31: as well as five years working with Docker in forensic domains
column32: have honed my skills in managing complex data and system environments.\n\nMy approach to software development is both systematic and creative
column33: ensuring that I not only solve problems but also innovate and improve existing processes. This capability is matched by my commitment to teamwork and collaboration
column34: often taking the initiative to lead and inspire my colleagues. I am particularly keen on sharing knowledge and learning from others
column35: which I believe fosters an enriching work environment.\n\nI am also adept at translating complex requirements into clear
column36: actionable plans and analyses—a skill that has been critical in delivering projects that meet and exceed expectations. My experience in environments that require high levels of security and precision
column38: has equipped me with a keen awareness of the nuances and critical nature of the projects at JenV.\n\nI am enthusiastic about the possibility of bringing my unique expertise to the Ministry of Justice and Security
column39:
contributing to your team’s success and ongoing projects. I am eager to bring my background in software engineering and my proactive approach to your esteemed ministry and am looking forward to the opportunity to discuss how my experiences and visions align with the goals of JenV.

Thank you for considering my application. I am looking forward to your positive response and hope to discuss my application in further detail.

Yours sincerely

column1: Requirements: Minimaal een afgeronde bachelor opleiding in Technische Informatica en/of Software Engineering
column2: Minimaal een certificaat in Scrum Foundations en/of Scrum Master
column3: Minimaal zeven (7) jaar werkervaring met diverse programmeertalen en tools waaronder in ieder geval Java en/of Python
column4: Minimaal vijf (5) jaar werkervaring met Postgres en/of Elasticsearch en/of Bamboo en/of Javascript
column5: Minimaal vijf (5) jaar werkervaring met het werken in het forensisch domein
column6: Minimaal drie (3) jaar werkervaring met Kubernetes en/of docker en/of Istio
column7: Aantoonbare ervaring met het schrijven van automatische testen
column8: Aantoonbare ervaring in het vertalen van requirements naar technische en/of functionele analyses

column1: Preferences: Een creatieve puzzelaar die zich graag vastbijt in complexe uitdagingen en doorgraaft tot de oplossing gevonden is
column2: Een teamspeler die energie krijgt van samenwerken en graag het initiatief neemt
column3: Kritisch en werkt op een nauwkeurige en systematische manier en toetst resultaten bij collega's
column4: Een pragmatische aanpak vanuit een oplossingsgerichte instelling
column5: Graag kennis en ervaringen deelt en nieuwsgierig is naar de ideeën van anderen
